name: Hosteria Las Dunas

reviews.text: This is my favorite hotel ive been to in El Calafate.
reviews.title: Incredible Service

reviews.text: It's one of the few places that know about customer service.
reviews.title: Great View, Exquisite Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You arrive and they offer you a free drink ( champagne, beer, soda, water ) and either chips or peanuts.
reviews.title: For this price you would expect better

reviews.text: The rooms have space and are clean and have an incredible view of lake argentina.
reviews.title: Fantasitc views and freindly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is RIGHT off the lake and I dont think any other hotel is this close.
reviews.title: A room with a view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in January and will definitely do so again if we return to Calafate. We don't have much to add to the other excellent reviews of the hotel, but I would like to emphasise how fantastic the staff are. Without exception they were warm, welcoming and very professional. We had a slight problem when we arrived because our booking had gone missing - not the hotel's fault. Without any fuss, the receptionist sat us down with a welcome glass of wine overlooking the lake, and sorted out a room for us for the first night, and another for the second.
reviews.title: Lovely place, the staff really make it special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a short drive out of Calafate - which was ideal for us. We hadn't come to see the town, we wanted to be near the lake and that's what we got. They run a shuttle to town, and getting a taxi is quite straightforward (20-25 pesos). It's also quite well located for the nature reserve nearby, where we spent one late evening. The other great thing about the hotel is the restaurant which served excellent, well-priced food, with a good-ish selection of wine. We dined there both nights, perfectly happily. We would recommend anyone staying elsewhere in Calafate to at least try the restaurant at Las Dunas.
reviews.title: great setting and service
Magnificent!
reviews.text: We thought all of the rooms at views of the lake (which is stunning): but i've read one review here which says they had one without a lake view, so you might want to check that when you make a booking.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great rooms with a view over the lake. From the hotel there is a great walk to the lake and the bird sanctuary. The rooms are simple but delightful. The breakfast was huge with many choices. The staff went out of their way to be helpful when we had a problem with our flight. I liked staying out of the town and having a view from the room particularly since the town is nothing special.
reviews.title: Very good - recommended.

reviews.text: Our stay at Las Dunas was amazing, we felt relaxed from the moment we arrived. The staff are outstanding, incredibly helpful with advice and arranging trips, going well beyond our expectations. The breakfast is superb, as was the restaurant- the perfect way to relax after action packed days! The view from our room was breathtaking. We would whole-heartedly recommend Las Dunas.
reviews.title: Sublime

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at Las Dunas on Oct 24-26, 2011. We were greeted by the front desk receptionist who told immediately to relax. We were given welcome drinks and little desserts. The hotel room was spacious with a very comfortable bed and clean bathroom. The view from the room was amazing.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the main strip. However, the hotel offers free shuttle servie to and from the main area but it does end early. The last bus to take you to the main area is approx 4:30pm and the last bus to take you back to the hotel is about 7:30pm. The walk is fine however there are a lot of stray dogs. One dog followed us all the way to the hotel for the last 5 minutes of our walk. Taxis are about $15-20 pesos one way.
reviews.title: Great views and service

reviews.text: The restaurant is great! We ate there for dinner twice. It has a good variety of dishes for a very good price. The buffet breakfast in the morning is awesome. If you have an early excurison, the staff can arrange for you to have breakfast earlier than their normal schedule.
reviews.title: Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, located in front of the lake, very close to the bird sanctuary.. The hotel is great, they greet you with snaks and drinks.. Small but very cosy roms..
reviews.title: Great value in a Patagonian setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is a little far from town but you can always catch a taxi or the regular bus.. Prices are good and excellent views of the lake and the flamingos
reviews.title: A charming hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a couple of nights here while visiting Patagonia to check out the Perito Moreno Glacier (you have to see the glacier, it is sooo worth it). While this hotel is located a little out of the main town (really it is just a main street) it is not inconvenient. You could walk to town easily and a the cab ride takes only a couple minutes.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Comfortable Enough Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What sells this place is the view; located practically on the shores of the Lago Argentino, you just cannot get a view like this if you stay in town. The huge windows (especially in the dining room and lobby) offer incredible view of the water and the mountains. It is such a peaceful place that before leaving you will stare and stare, taking a mental snapshot that you hope won't fade with time.
reviews.title: Amazing view, friendly staff, awesome food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you arrive the staff will serve you a snack and allow you to check in at a nice slow pace. Then any request you have, if you need help dealing with pesky Aerolineas Argentinas for example, they will be there for you. The breakfast service person is also really great. The rooms are nothing spectacular but they are comfortable and clean, with nice enough bathroom accomodations and free internet on various computers through out the hotel. We tried using the wifi but like at most Argentinean hotels it was VERY hard and almost impossible to get any reception.
reviews.title: A really good Hotel with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lastly, if you are visiting El Calafate you MUST eat at Casimiro. There are three, a grill, restaurant and a pasta place I think. We ate at 2 of them (this includes the grill which serves Patagonian lamb that is simply divine) and had excellent meals and service at both.
reviews.title: Spectacular views, warmest possible servie

reviews.text: From the first minute we arrived, we knew we had found the perfect place in El Calafate. The staff were all great, especially Ignacio, who took time to talk to us about all of the various sights to visit. His suggestions were all extremely helpful. He also helped sort out a minor problem. For some reason, Booking.com had given us a room with two twin beds. He told us, "no problem, we'll fix this" and he had the room converted to a large bed. Ignacio is the man! The food was also delicious; don't skip the steak!
reviews.title: we will love to come back!

aka: Hosteria Las Dunas El Calafate, Argentina - Patagonia
description: Situated in a heavenly place, at only a distance of 2, 5 kilometers from Calafate downtown, Hosteria Las Dunas provides you with a chance to live an unforgettable experience of peace and contact with the surrounding nature. Built on the traditional Patagonian architecture, inside you will find a family warm atmosphere in which leather, iron and wood predominate over.Hosteria Las Dunas offers an intimate contact with nature, the surrounding flora and wild bird fauna which will accompany you at all times. You will be able to delight with an excellent Patagonian cuisine and a service of the highest standards of quality and attention.In Hosteria Las Dunas, anytime is the time, during every minute of your stay you will discover the charm of our Patagonian region. In this way and just relaxing in our exclusive deck, you will have the opportunity to enjoy without any limits of the natural beauty of the Patagonian scenery with imposing panoramic views of Laguna Nimez, a birds natural reserve and the Argentinean lake which extends to Perito Moreno glacier. From every corner of the building, you will also be able to glance at the charm of Isla Solitaria while you take in great memories of your visit to Calafate.
